title: Amazon's air cargo head changes jobs, will now oversee workplace-safety unit
description: Sarah Rhoads, who joined Amazon in 2011, has become one of Amazon's top logistics executives and helped to rapidly expand its air-cargo arm.

title: JPMorgan is developing a ChatGPT-like A.I. service that gives investment advice
description: Banks including Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley are testing A.I. internally, but JPMorgan may be the first to release a GPT-like product directly to customers.

title: Chinese state-sponsored hackers infiltrated U.S. naval infrastructure, Secretary of the Navy says
description: The U.S. Navy was "impacted" by Chinese state-backed hackers, which targeted infrastructure in the U.S. and Guam in an attack first flagged by Microsoft.

title: JPMorgan Chase says Jeffrey Epstein paid tuition for kids of U.S. Virgin Islands governor
description: The U.S. Virgin Islands alleges in a lawsuit JPMorgan Chase facilitated sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein, a predator who lived in the American territory.

title: Nvidia shares surge to record close with 24% rally
description: Nvidia shares are on track to beat the company's 2021 all-time high closing price after it significantly beat estimates, driven in part by an AI frenzy.

title: Microsoft is sprinkling OpenAI everywhere to try and keep software makers interested in its platforms
description: This week Microsoft gave developers a slew of new tools to take advantage of artificial intelligence, thanks to a broad alliance with startup OpenAI.

title: NRO director says commercial space industry helps fuel the spy satellite agency’s ambitious goals
description: NRO Director Chris Scolese said the agency is looking to advance new technologies like artificial intelligence, machine learning and quantum sensing.

title: A.I. cryptocurrencies jump after Nvidia reports booming artificial intelligence demand
description: AI-themed cryptocurrencies got a lift on Thursday from excitement around Nvidia and its increasing demand for chips that power AI applications.

title: How the A.I. explosion could save the market and maybe the economy
description: Whether it's personalized shopping or self-driving cars, AI will become a factor in virtually everyone's lives.

title: 'I'm not sure history has ever seen this before': Top CEOs on what they expect next from the economy
description: Top CEOs at the CNBC CEO Council Summit say if recession is ahead, infrastructure and Inflation Reduction Act spending will make it a unique one.

title: Debt ceiling negotiations intensify as Fitch ratings warning on U.S. credit adds urgency
description: White House and Republican negotiators appear to have made little discernible progress in more than a week of near round-the-clock talks.

title: Ford CEO Jim Farley says Chinese automakers like BYD are its greatest EV rivals
description: Ford CEO Jim Farley used Warren Buffett-backed BYD as the prime example of a Chinese automaker that has successfully developed and sold EVs.

title: Scientists propose long Covid definition based on key symptoms in large study
description: The proposed definition is based on 12 symptoms that most separate people with long Covid from people who didn't have the coronavirus.

title: What a 'normal' peak retail trade season could look like this year
description: Peak retail trade season for back-to-school and holiday shopping begins in July and there's hope for an uptick from 2022, but some shipping CEOs are doubtful.

title: Microsoft outlines its vision for keeping A.I. in check
description: Among the suggestions is a version of the financial service sector's Know Your Customer rules adapted for AI.

title: Nvidia nears elite trillion-dollar market cap club of Apple, Microsoft, Alphabet and Amazon
description: The surge in Nvidia following its explosive sales guidance could help catapult the stock into the group of public companies with a $1 trillion market cap.

title: Two of the world's most critical chip firms rally after Nvidia's 26% share price surge
description: Dutch firm ASML and Taiwan's TSMC, two of the world's most important semiconductor firms, got a share price boost after Nvidia's earnings impressed investors.

title: Chinese augmented reality glasses maker Nreal rebrands as Xreal as it takes on tech giants
description: Chinese augmented reality glasses maker Nreal rebranded to Xreal — a name it hopes will encapsulate its expansion into Europe and latest products.

title: Boss of Goldman-backed digital bank Starling to step down next month
description: Starling CEO Anne Boden is to step down on June 30. She will hand the reins to Starling's COO John Mountain, who has been with the bank since 2015.

title: UK net migration hits record high of 606,000 as government vows cuts and cracks down on student visas
description: The ruling Conservative party has overseen record rises in net migration despite its election promise to reduce the figure.

title: UK borrowing rates close in on last year's 'mini-budget' crisis levels
description: New data on Wednesday showed that the U.K. consumer price inflation rate fell by less than expected in April.

title: Canada, Saudi Arabia rekindle diplomatic relations after 2018 human rights rift
description: Canada has now appointed Jean-Philippe Linteau as new ambassador to Saudi Arabia.

title: Call to ‘Buy Japan’ is premature, say Bank of America analysts
description: Strategists say the approach to buy Japanese stocks as well as the yen — could be one for next year, not this year.

title: German economy enters recession as first-quarter GDP data is revised lower
description: The German economy entered a technical recession in the first quarter of this year, after posting a contraction of 0.3% over the three-month period.

title: Turkey's runoff election is paralyzing key oil exports from northern Iraq
description: The Turkish port of Ceyhan typically ships out exports of Iraq's northern Kirkuk crude oil.

title: Fossil fuel investment set to exceed $1 trillion in 2023, 'more than double' levels needed for a net-zero future: IEA
description: The effect of coal, gas and oil on the environment is considerable.

title: China's Lenovo shrugs off concerns that global PC market is shrinking
description: Global personal computer demand continued to slump and revenues fell for a third consecutive quarter but China's PC maker Lenovo is not worried.

title: Milk prices in the world's dairy powerhouse India have spiked 15%
description: India is facing an increase in milk prices on the back of higher feed costs, an increase in demand for sweets, and a contagious cattle disease.

title: As debt ceiling talks flounder, Cramer says lawmakers' actions will cost you
description: CNBC's Jim Cramer warned investors on Wednesday that lawmakers will inevitably cost them money as debt ceiling negotiations drag on.
